template.name: TrueNAS by SNMP
template.description:
Template for monitoring TrueNAS by SNMP Setup: 1. Import template into Zabbix 2. Enable SNMP daemon at Services in TrueNAS web interface https://www.truenas.com/docs/core/services/snmp 3. Link template to the host
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB SNMPv2-MIB UCD-DISKIO-MIB UCD-SNMP-MIB FREENAS-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.41

item.name: TrueNAS: ICMP ping
item.description: Host accessibility by ICMP. 0 - ICMP ping fails. 1 - ICMP ping successful.

trigger.name: TrueNAS: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

item.name: TrueNAS: ICMP loss
item.description: Percentage of lost packets.

trigger.expression: min(/TrueNAS by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/TrueNAS by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: TrueNAS: High ICMP ping loss

item.name: TrueNAS: ICMP response time
item.description: ICMP ping response time (in seconds).

trigger.name: TrueNAS: High ICMP ping response time
trigger.description: Average ICMP response time is too big.

item.name: TrueNAS: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: TrueNAS: Interrupts per second
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Number of interrupts processed.

item.name: TrueNAS: Load average (1m avg)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The 1 minute load averages.

item.name: TrueNAS: Load average (5m avg)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The 5 minutes load averages.

item.name: TrueNAS: Load average (15m avg)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The 15 minutes load averages.

item.name: TrueNAS: Number of CPUs
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB Count the number of CPU cores by counting number of cores discovered in hrProcessorTable using LLD.

parameters.parameter: //count the number of cores return JSON.parse(value).length;

item.name: TrueNAS: Context switches per second
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Number of context switches.

item.name: TrueNAS: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB System description of the host.

item.name: TrueNAS: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node. If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: TrueNAS: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB System host name.

trigger.expression: last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/system.name))>0
trigger.name: TrueNAS: System name has changed
trigger.event_name: TrueNAS: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: TrueNAS: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining what kind of box is being managed.

item.name: TrueNAS: Free swap space
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The amount of swap space currently unused or available.

item.name: TrueNAS: Free swap space in %
item.description: The free space of swap volume/file in percent.

item.name: TrueNAS: Total swap space
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The total amount of swap space configured for this host.

item.name: TrueNAS: Uptime
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB System uptime in 'N days, hh:mm:ss' format.

item.name: TrueNAS: ARC target size of cache
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB ARC target size of cache in bytes.

item.name: TrueNAS: ARC data size
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB ARC data size used in bytes.

item.name: TrueNAS: ARC cache hit ratio
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB ARC cache hit ration percentage.

item.name: TrueNAS: ARC hits
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB Total amount of cache hits in the ARC per second.

item.name: TrueNAS: ARC metadata size
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB ARC metadata size used in bytes.

item.name: TrueNAS: ARC cache miss ratio
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB ARC cache miss ration percentage.

item.name: TrueNAS: ARC misses
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB Total amount of cache misses in the ARC per second.

item.name: TrueNAS: ARC target size of MRU
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB ARC target size of MRU in bytes.

item.name: TrueNAS: ARC size
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB ARC size in bytes.

item.name: TrueNAS: L2ARC hits
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB Hits to the L2 cache per second.

item.name: TrueNAS: L2ARC misses
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB Misses to the L2 cache per second.

item.name: TrueNAS: L2ARC read rate
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB Read rate from L2 cache in bytes per second.

item.name: TrueNAS: L2ARC size
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB L2ARC size in bytes.

item.name: TrueNAS: L2ARC write rate
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB Write rate from L2 cache in bytes per second.

item.name: TrueNAS: ZIL operations 1 second
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The ops column parsed from the command zilstat 1 1.

item.name: TrueNAS: ZIL operations 5 seconds
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The ops column parsed from the command zilstat 5 1.

item.name: TrueNAS: ZIL operations 10 seconds
item.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The ops column parsed from the command zilstat 10 1.

item.name: TrueNAS: Available memory
item.description: Please note that memory utilization is a rough estimate, since memory available is calculated as free+buffers+cached, which is not 100% accurate, but the best we can get using SNMP.

item.name: TrueNAS: Memory (buffers)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as memory buffers.

item.name: TrueNAS: Memory (cached)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as cached memory.

item.name: TrueNAS: Free memory
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The amount of real/physical memory currently unused or available.

item.name: TrueNAS: Total memory
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Total memory in Bytes.

item.name: TrueNAS: Memory utilization
item.description: Please note that memory utilization is a rough estimate, since memory available is calculated as free+buffers+cached, which is not 100% accurate, but the best we can get using SNMP.

trigger.name: TrueNAS: High memory utilization
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

dependency.name: TrueNAS: Lack of available memory
dependency.expression: min(/TrueNAS by SNMP/vm.memory.available,5m)<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/vm.memory.total)>0

item.name: TrueNAS: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible value: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: TrueNAS: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

discovery_rule.name: CPU discovery
discovery_rule.description: This discovery will create set of per core CPU metrics from UCD-SNMP-MIB, using {#CPU.COUNT} in preprocessing. That's the only reason why LLD is used.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: CPU idle time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: CPU interrupt time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

parameters.parameter: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPU.COUNT}

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: CPU iowait time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

parameters.parameter: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPU.COUNT}

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: CPU nice time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

parameters.parameter: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPU.COUNT}

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: CPU system time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

parameters.parameter: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPU.COUNT}

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: CPU user time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

parameters.parameter: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPU.COUNT}

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: CPU utilization in %.

trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: High CPU utilization
trigger_prototype.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

dependency.name: TrueNAS: Load average is too high

parameters.parameter: //count the number of CPU cores return JSON.stringify([{"{#CPU.COUNT}": value, "{#SNMPINDEX}": 0, "{#SINGLETON}":""}])

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High input error rate
trigger_prototype.event_name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High input error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High output error rate
trigger_prototype.event_name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High output error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Link down
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and ( last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=6 or last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=7 or last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=11 or last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=62 or last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=69 or last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=117 ) and (last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or (last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2)
trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.in[{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High inbound bandwidth usage
trigger_prototype.event_name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High inbound bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.out[{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High outbound bandwidth usage
trigger_prototype.event_name: TrueNAS: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High outbound bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Disk [{#DISK_NAME}]: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The temperature of this HDD in mC.

trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Disk [{#DISK_NAME}]: Average disk temperature is too high
trigger_prototype.event_name: TrueNAS: Disk [{#DISK_NAME}]: Average disk temperature is too high (over {$TEMPERATURE.MAX.CRIT:"{#DISK_NAME}"}C for 5m)

trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Disk [{#DISK_NAME}]: Average disk temperature is too high
trigger_prototype.event_name: TrueNAS: Disk [{#DISK_NAME}]: Average disk temperature is too high (over {$TEMPERATURE.MAX.WARN:"{#DISK_NAME}"}C for 5m)

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Dataset [{#DATASET_NAME}]: Available space
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The available size of the dataset in bytes.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Dataset [{#DATASET_NAME}]: Usage in %
item_prototype.description: The used size of the dataset in %.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Dataset [{#DATASET_NAME}]: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The size of the dataset in bytes.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Dataset [{#DATASET_NAME}]: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The used size of the dataset in bytes.

trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Dataset [{#DATASET_NAME}]: High space usage
trigger_prototype.event_name: TrueNAS: Dataset [{#DATASET_NAME}]: High space usage (more than {$DATASET.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#DATASET_NAME}"}% used)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$DATASET.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#DATASET_NAME}"}%. Second condition: The dataset free space is less than {$DATASET.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#POOLNAME}"}.

dependency.name: TrueNAS: Dataset [{#DATASET_NAME}]: Very high space usage

trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Dataset [{#DATASET_NAME}]: Very high space usage
trigger_prototype.event_name: TrueNAS: Dataset [{#DATASET_NAME}]: Very high space usage (more than {$DATASET.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#DATASET_NAME}"}% used)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$DATASET.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#DATASET_NAME}"}%. Second condition: The dataset free space is less than {$DATASET.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#POOLNAME}"}.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Available space
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The available size of the storage pool in bytes.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Health
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The current health of the containing pool, as reported by zpool status.

trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Status is not online

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Usage in %
item_prototype.description: The used size of the storage pool in %.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Read rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The bandwidth of all read operations (including metadata), expressed as units per second (averaged since system booted).

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Read operations rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The number of read I/O operations sent to the pool or device, including metadata requests (averaged since system booted).

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The size of the storage pool in bytes.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The used size of the storage pool in bytes.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Write rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The bandwidth of all write operations, expressed as units per second (averaged since system booted).

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Write operations rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The number of write I/O operations sent to the pool or device (averaged since system booted).

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/TrueNAS by SNMP/truenas.zpool.pused[{#POOLNAME}],5m) > {$ZPOOL.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#POOLNAME}"} and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/truenas.zpool.avail[{#POOLNAME}]) < {$ZPOOL.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#POOLNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: High space usage
trigger_prototype.event_name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: High space usage (more than {$ZPOOL.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#POOLNAME}"}% used)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$ZPOOL.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#POOLNAME}"}%. Second condition: The pool free space is less than {$ZPOOL.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#POOLNAME}"}.

dependency.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Very high space usage
dependency.expression: min(/TrueNAS by SNMP/truenas.zpool.pused[{#POOLNAME}],5m) > {$ZPOOL.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#POOLNAME}"} and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/truenas.zpool.avail[{#POOLNAME}]) < {$ZPOOL.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#POOLNAME}"}

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/TrueNAS by SNMP/truenas.zpool.pused[{#POOLNAME}],5m) > {$ZPOOL.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#POOLNAME}"} and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/truenas.zpool.avail[{#POOLNAME}]) < {$ZPOOL.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#POOLNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Very high space usage
trigger_prototype.event_name: TrueNAS: Pool [{#POOLNAME}]: Very high space usage (more than {$ZPOOL.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#POOLNAME}"}% used)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$ZPOOL.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#POOLNAME}"}%. Second condition: The pool free space is less than {$ZPOOL.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#POOLNAME}"}.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: ZFS volume [{#ZVOL_NAME}]: Available space
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The available of the ZFS volume in bytes.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: ZFS volume [{#ZVOL_NAME}]: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The size of the ZFS volume in bytes.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: ZFS volume [{#ZVOL_NAME}]: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: FREENAS-MIB The used size of the ZFS volume in bytes.

discovery_rule.name: Block devices discovery
discovery_rule.description: Block devices are discovered from UCD-DISKIO-MIB::diskIOTable (http://net-snmp.sourceforge.net/docs/mibs/ucdDiskIOMIB.html#diskIOTable).

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: [{#DEVNAME}]: Disk read rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-DISKIO-MIB The number of read accesses from this device since boot.

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: [{#DEVNAME}]: Disk utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-DISKIO-MIB The 1 minute average load of disk (%).

item_prototype.name: TrueNAS: [{#DEVNAME}]: Disk write rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-DISKIO-MIB The number of write accesses from this device since boot.

macro.description: Threshold of CPU utilization for warning trigger in %.
This macro is used for trigger expression. It can be overridden on the host or linked on the template level.
This macro is used for trigger expression. It can be overridden on the host or linked on the template level.
This macro is used in datasets discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in datasets discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
Threshold of used dataset space for average severity trigger in %.
Threshold of used dataset space for warning trigger in %.
Threshold of ICMP packets loss for warning trigger in %.
Threshold of average ICMP response time for warning trigger in seconds.
Threshold of error packets rate for warning trigger. Can be used with interface name as context.
Threshold of interface bandwidth utilization for warning trigger in %. Can be used with interface name as context.
Macro for operational state of the interface for link down trigger. Can be used with interface name as context.
Load per CPU considered sustainable. Tune if needed.
Threshold of available memory for trigger in bytes.
Threshold of memory utilization for trigger in %
This macro is used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
Ignore down(2) administrative status
This macro is used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro is used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
Ignore notPresent(6)
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
The time interval for SNMP availability trigger.
Threshold of free swap space for warning trigger in %.
This macro is used for trigger expression. It can be overridden on the host or linked on the template level.
This macro is used for trigger expression. It can be overridden on the host or linked on the template level.
This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used for trigger expression. It can be overridden on the host or linked on the template level.
This macro is used for trigger expression. It can be overridden on the host or linked on the template level.
Threshold of used pool space for average severity trigger in %.
Threshold of used pool space for warning trigger in %.

trigger.expression: min(/TrueNAS by SNMP/system.swap.pfree,5m)<{$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN} and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/system.swap.total)>0
trigger.name: TrueNAS: High swap space usage
trigger.event_name: TrueNAS: High swap space usage (less than {$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN}% free)
trigger.description: This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured.

dependency.name: TrueNAS: Lack of available memory
dependency.expression: min(/TrueNAS by SNMP/vm.memory.available,5m)<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/vm.memory.total)>0

trigger.expression: min(/TrueNAS by SNMP/vm.memory.available,5m)<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and last(/TrueNAS by SNMP/vm.memory.total)>0
trigger.name: TrueNAS: Lack of available memory
trigger.event_name: TrueNAS: Lack of available memory (<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
trigger.description: The system is running out of memory.

trigger.name: TrueNAS: Load average is too high
trigger.event_name: TrueNAS: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.
